meanings.definition: To force or trick (someone) into doing something, typically into joining a ship's crew.
meanings.sent1: The pirates tried to shanghai the sailors into working on their ship.
meanings.sent2: He was shanghaied into becoming a crew member without his consent.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids jokingly tried to shanghai their friend into cleaning their room.
meanings.sent4: The persuasive salesman managed to shanghai the hesitant customer into buying the product.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox shanghaied the rabbit into helping him escape the hunters.

meanings.sent1: Shanghai is known for its modern skyscrapers and bustling streets.
meanings.sent2: I visited Shanghai last summer and was amazed by its vibrant culture.
meanings.sent3: The panda dreamt of visiting Shanghai to see the famous Oriental Pearl Tower.
meanings.sent4: Her mind drifted to Shanghai, a city of endless possibilities and opportunities.
meanings.sent5: Shanghai, with its blend of tradition and innovation, captivates visitors from around the world.
